title: Dry weather to ease as showers, strong winds forecast: Met Department
byline: The Meteorology Department yesterday said the prevailing dry weather conditions are expected to ease, with several spells of showers forecast across many parts of the island.

title: Six police officers remanded over alleged assault of priest
byline: Six police officers from the Gampaha Division Crimes Investigation Bureau were arrested and remanded following a complaint over an alleged assault on a Catholic priest.

title: How soaring silver prices threaten global tech and green energy sectors
byline: Silver, often overshadowed by gold in financial headlines, is quietly undergoing a market revolution. However, unlike its more illustrious counterpart, silver’s price surge is not merely a story of monetary hedging or speculative investment. It is a direct threat to the foundational pillars of the 21st-century economy: the green energy transition and the global technology ecosystem. As prices climb on the world market, industries from solar power

title: Gold tops $5,000 for first time ever, adding to historic rally
byline: The price of gold has risen above $5,000 (£3,659) an ounce for the first time ever, extending a historic rally that saw the precious metal jump by more than 60% in 2025.

title: Ferry carrying over 350 people sinks in Philippines, killing at least 15
byline: A ferry carrying more than 350 people has capsized off the southern Philippine province of Basilan, killing at least 15 people, according to officials.

title: GMOA launches continuous trade union action from today
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) yesterday announced that it will commence continuous trade union action from 8.00 a.m. today (26), citing shortcomings in facilities and staffing within the state health sector.

title: Probe launched against NUTU Kandy Vice President: Union
byline: The National United Teachers’ Union (NUTU) yesterday alleged that a disciplinary investigation has been initiated against its Vice President in Kandy for highlighting shortcomings in the ongoing education reforms.

title: Gunmen kill 11 at soccer field in Mexico
byline: A group of men opened fire at a soccer field in the central Mexican state of Guanajuato, killing at least 11 people and wounding 12 more, authorities said.

title: National drive launched to restore cyclone-hit religious sites
byline: The Presidential Media Division (PMD) said that the inauguration of the ‘Godanagamu Adhisthanaye Sanhinda’ national programme, aimed at reconstructing religious sites damaged by Cyclone Ditwah, will take place tomorrow (27) under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: South Korea mourns death of former prime minister who nurtured democracy
byline: South Korean former Prime Minister Lee Hae-chan, a veteran politician and influential fixture on the country’s road to democracy, died during an official visit to Vietnam’s southern hub of Ho Chi Minh City, both governments said.

title: Sri Lanka FDI surges 72% to $1.06 bn in 2025
byline: Sri Lanka recorded a sharp rise in foreign direct investment (FDI) in 2025, with inflows reaching USD 1,057 million, reflecting a 72 percent increase compared to the previous year, the Board of Investment (BOI) said.

title: Catholic Church in SL to file FR against assault of a priest
byline: The Catholic Church in Sri Lanka is to file a Fundamental Rights petition against the police officers who had assaulted a priest in Negombo over the weekend, Spokesman for Archdiocese of Colombo Fr. Cyril Gamini Fernando said yesterday.

title: Private jet carrying 8 people crashes in Bangor, Maine: FAA
byline: A private jet carrying eight people crashed as it was taking off from Bangor International Airport in Maine on Sunday night, according to the Federal Aviation Administration.

title: Ranil and Sajith to decide on leader
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe and Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa are expected to meet shortly to decide as to who would lead the proposed UNP and SJB alliance, UNP Deputy General Secretary Harin Fernando said yesterday.

title: Test tube baby treatment to begin in Govt. hospitals
byline: Sri Lanka is set to introduce test-tube baby treatment, also known as In Vitro Fertilization (IVF), at the Castle Street Hospital for Women in Colombo marking the first time such advanced fertility services will be made available at a government hospital.

title: At least 20 injured in Bibila road accident
byline: At least 20 people were injured in a road accident today (26) in the Yalkumbura area along the Bibila–Badulla road.

title: About 30% of Sri Lankan adults suffer from mental health issues: Expert
byline: Nearly 30 percent of Sri Lanka’s adult population is affected by mental health problems, Consultant Psychiatrist Dr. Madhushani Dias said on Sunday.

title: Deputy Minister defends ‘buddy’ remarks
byline: Deputy Minister Mahinda Jayasinghe has defended his recent comments in Parliament on the term “buddy,” saying his remarks were based on content found in a Grade 11 Information and Communication Technology (ICT) textbook and not on his own technical expertise.

title: CID complaint lodged over use of cancer drug marketed by unregistered company
byline: MP Mujibur Rahman today lodged a complaint with the CID against the import and use of a drug on cancer patients.

title: Gunmen kill 11 at soccer field in Mexico
byline: A group of men opened fire at a soccer field in the central Mexican state of Guanajuato, killing at least 11 people and wounding 12 more, authorities said.

title: Customs ‘cozy trends’ could only addressed through well rewarding system: Minister
byline: The prevailing ‘cozy trends’ of Sri Lanka Customs that usually lead to allegations of bribes and corruption could be addressed only through a well rewarding system, Finance and Planning Deputy Minister Dr. Anil Jayantha said today.

title: CSE trades sideways as market enters consolidation near 24,000
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange began the week on a mixed note, with investor sentiment remaining largely subdued as the market showed signs of consolidation near the key 24,000 level.

title: Namal highlights India–Sri Lanka ties, youth leadership at India’s 77th Republic Day event
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organizer and Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa underscored the importance of responsible leadership, regional solidarity and youth-driven change while addressing the 77th Republic Day of India celebrations at the Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) in Bhubaneswar, Odisha.

title: Pathfinder Foundation launches repository to preserve Sri Lanka’s peace initiatives
byline: The Pathfinder Foundation has inaugurated a dedicated repository to document Sri Lanka’s peace initiatives, aiming to preserve the country’s efforts to resolve the separatist conflict over the decades.

title: India, Sri Lanka have made  significant progress in physical, energy connectivity: Indian High Commissioner
byline: While highlighting that India and Sri Lanka had become a global model for cooperation with neighbours, Indian High Commissioner in Colombo Santhosh Jha said today that both countries have made significant progress in physical and energy connectivity.

title: Oversight Committee approves Bills to amend laws on dangerous drugs
byline: The Sectoral Oversight Committee on Governance, Justice and Civil Protection has approved the two Bills, Poisons, Opium and Dangerous Drugs (Amendment) and the Judicature (Amendment) Bills.

title: Opposition creating unrest over education reforms: Bimal Rathnayake
byline: Transport, Highways and Urban Development Minister Bimal Rathnayake today accused the Opposition and its Leader, Sajith Premadasa, of deliberately creating unrest in the country, claiming their actions had led to the postponement of certain aspects of the new education reforms.
